translations.description: Always energetic and full of life, Amber's the best - albeit only - Outrider of the Knights of Favonius.
translations.name: Amber

translations.description: Every denizen of Mondstadt adores Barbara. However, she learned the word "idol" from a magazine.
translations.name: Barbara

translations.description: Beidou is the leader of the Crux an armed fleet based in Liyue Harbor. An armed fleet means exactly what it sounds like: a fleet of ships armed to the teeth
translations.name: Beidou

translations.description: A righteous and good-natured adventurer from Mondstadt who's unfortunately extremely unlucky.
translations.name: Bennett

translations.description: A young exortcist from a family of exorcists. He does everything he can to suppress his pure positive energy.
translations.name: Chongyun

translations.description: The tycoon of a winery empire in Mondstadt, unmatched in every possible way.
translations.name: Diluc

translations.description: A young lady who has inherited trace amounts of non-human blood. She is the incredible popular bartender of the Cat's Tail tavern.
translations.name: Diona

translations.description: A mysterious girl who calls herself "Prinzessia der Verurteilung" and travels with a night raven named Oz.
translations.name: Fischl

translations.description: The righteous and rigorous Dandelion Knight, and Acting Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius in Mondstadt.
translations.name: Jean

translations.description: A thinker in the Knights of Favonius with a somewhat exotic appearance.
translations.name: Kaeya

translations.description: The Yuheng of the Liyue Qixing. Has much to say about Rex Lapis' unilateral approach to policymaking in Liyue - but in truth, gods admire skeptics such as her quite a lot.
translations.name: Keqing

translations.description: An explosives expert and a regular at the Knights of Favonius' confinement room. Also known as Fleeing Sunlight.
translations.name: Klee

translations.description: The languid but knowledgeable Librarian of the Knights of Favonius who was deemed by Sumeru Academia to be their most distinguised graduate in the past two centuries.
translations.name: Lisa

translations.description: A mysterious young astrologer who proclaims herself to be "Astrologist Mona Megistus," and who possesses abilities to match the title.
translations.name: Mona

translations.description: The Tianquan of Liyue Qixing. Her wealth is unsurpassed in all of Teyvat.
translations.name: Ningguang

translations.description: A maid in the service of the Knights of Favonius that dreams of joining their ranks someday.
translations.name: Noelle

translations.description: An apprentice and herb-picker Bubu Pharmacy. An undead with a bone-white complexion, she seldom has much in the way of words or emotion.
translations.name: Qiqi

translations.description: A boy who lives among the wolves in Wolvendom of Mondstadt, away from human civilization. As agile as lightning.
translations.name: Razor

translations.description: An alchemist filled with curiosity about all things. She researches bio-alchemy.
translations.name: Sucrose

translations.description: No. 11 of The Harbingers, also known as "Childe". His name is highly feared on the battlefield.
translations.name: Tartaglia

translations.description: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.
translations.name: Traveler Anemo

translations.description: A traveler from another world who had their only kin taken away, forcing them to embark on a journey to find The Seven.
translations.name: Traveler Geo

translations.description: One of the many bards of Mondstadt, who freely wanders the city's streets and alleys.
translations.name: Venti

translations.description: A renowned chef from Liyue. She's extremely passionate about cooking and excels at making her signature hot and spicy dishes.
translations.name: Xiangling

translations.description: A young man carrying a longsword who is frequently seen at book booths. He has a chivalrous heart and yearns for justice and fairness for all.
translations.name: Xingqiu

translations.description: Liyue's sole rock 'n' roll musician. She rebels against ossified prejudices using her music and passionate singing.
translations.name: Xinyan

translations.description: A mysterious guest invited by the Wangsheng Funeral Parlor. Extremely knowledgeable in all things.
translations.name: Zhongli

translations.description: Common currency
translations.name: Mora

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Agnidus Agate Silver

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Agnidus Agate Fragment

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Agnidus Agate Chunk

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Agnidus Agate Gemstone

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Varunada Lazurite Silver

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Varunada Lazurite Fragment

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Varunada Lazurite Chunk

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Varunada Lazurite Gemstone

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Vajrada Amethyst Silver

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Vajrada Amethyst Fragment

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Vajrada Amethyst Chunk

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Vajrada Amethyst Gemstone

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Shivada Jade Silver

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Shivada Jade Fragment

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Shivada Jade Chunk

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Shivada Jade Gemstone

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Vayuda Turquise Silver

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Vayuda Turquise Fragment

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Vayuda Turquise Chunk

translations.description: Character Ascension Material
translations.name: Vayuda Turquise Gemstone

translations.description: The imploded form of an Anemo Hypostasis upon its defeat. It contains the essence of Anemo energy. It is said that the power to create hurricanes resides within its seemingly fragile body. This butterfly of pure Anemo energy must be waiting for the day to conjure up storms once again
translations.name: Hurricane Seed

translations.description: An Electro Hypostasis channels nearby elemental energy to repair damaged elemental entities. It contains the essence of Electro energy. A common prism separates white light into component colors; a Lightning Prism, however, channels flowing energy and weaves them into lighting. It will continue to do so even after the Electro Hypostasis has been defeated.
translations.name: Lightning Prism

translations.description: The exposed core of a defeated Cryo Regisvine. Pure cryo elements are contained within it. Energy and thoughts that swell deep within the earth will eventually erupt on the surface. Even the deathly silent frost will attach to creatures on the ground, causing even the vines and branches of vegetation to become huge and fierce, attracting the hunter's gaze.
translations.name: Hoarfrost Core

translations.description: A pillar form by the shell of a Geo Hypostasis. It is composed of high-density Geo energy. This is the heaviest component of a Geo Element. Maybe the reason a Geo Hypostasis creates this polar out of its shell and raises itself is just to get closer to the sky, not to combat enemies.
translations.name: Basalt Pillar

translations.description: A scoop of eternal water left by an oceanid. Though it has already diffused among the depths of the lake, its purity remains all the same. But why would a creature so pure and clean as an oceanid desire the appearance of plants born of the ground and assume such a form with pure water? They need not breathe nor do they require sustenance...
translations.name: Cleansing Heart

translations.description:
A seed that fuels the unending flames of the Pyro Regisvine. It emits pyro energy as if it will burn all that has ever sprouted from the ground.
Endless desires flow among turbulent energy deep within the earth. What desire could steadily hold such fire to the plants and long so eagerly to bathe everything in unquenchable flames?
translations.name: Everflame Seed

translations.description: A wild grass that emits light at night. Used in cooking to enhance other flavors.
translations.name: Small Lamp Grass

translations.description: A fungus that grows in the warm caress of the wind. It is as everlasting as the wind, nourishing life.
translations.name: Philanemo Mushroom

translations.description: A rare mineral that glimmers in the dark. It's said to be a mutated gemstone condensed from the flourishing elements of the world.
translations.name: Noctilucous Jade

translations.description: A precious crystal of condensed pure Geo element that usually grows along with other minerals. It's also commonly called "Cor Petrae."
translations.name: Cor Lapis

translations.description: A plant that adores the wind. To the proud children of the wind, or the citizens of Mondstadt, the Windwheel Asters are the "visible winds."
translations.name: Windwheel Aster

translations.description: A flower that grows near water sources. When cooked the petals have a chunky texture, yet are sweet and a little bitter.
translations.name: Calla Lily

translations.description: A tiny seed that rides on the wind. Even without its feathered wings, it still holds the hope from afar within.
translations.name: Dandelion Seed

translations.description: A plump and translucent berry that has a fragrant smell and a sweet refreshing taste. In the past, the watchers of the storms found solace in the sweetness of the fruit and the hope for the city's security.
translations.name: Valberry

translations.description: An extremely ancient flower that was said to be commonly seen in Liyue. It transforms the memories of the land into its fragrance during florescence.
translations.name: Glaze Lily

translations.description: A small flower with strong vitality. It was said its downward-blooming flower keeps its fragrance from dissipating.
translations.name: Violetgrass

translations.description: A berry with thorns that often gets attached to a wolf's pelt. When you look at it, you can almost hear the echoing cries of the wolves in the woods.
translations.name: Wolfhook

translations.description: Empty seashells brought ashore by the tides. Hold it close to your ear, and hear the longing calls of the sea.
translations.name: Starconch

translations.description: A beautiful flower with a name that suits its appearance. It only grows where harsh winds blow, and is just as intangible as the true heart of an unbound soul.
translations.name: Cecilia

translations.description: A spicy plant native to Liyue. Merely smelling it makes one hot and thirsty.
translations.name: Jueyun Chili

translations.description: A crimson flower that blooms like the rainbow clouds in Liyue. It can be made into silky-smooth fabric.
translations.name: Silk Flower

translations.description: A roughly produced arrowhead. Though unimpressive, neither it nor the bow should be underestimated, for even the bravest knight can be felled by an arrow from the rear.
translations.name: Firm Arrowhead

translations.description: A well-made arrowhead. Sharp enough to penetrate armor with the ease of a rock through the surface of water.
translations.name: Sharp Arrowhead

translations.description: An old arrowhead coated in blood. The arrowhead has long since lost its sharpness and thus its use as a weapon. However it represents the pride of a hunter and acts as both an amulet and a medal.
translations.name: Weatherd Arrowhead

translations.description: A scroll that likely relates to some kind of magic. Exudes an inexplicable but ominous warmth.
translations.name: Divining Scroll

translations.description: An old scroll lacking in detail and clarity. By following the images on it, some magical creatures can recreate a small part of its magic.
translations.name: Sealed Scroll

translations.description: A scroll inscribed with ancient images. It is said that few can decipher its meaning, and the few scholars that have all went mad.
translations.name: Forbidden Curse Scroll

translations.description: A signet that proudly represents it's owner's position as a member of the Treasure Hoarders. The pursuit of treasure knows no bounds. That said... is being a thief something to be proud of?
translations.name: Treasure Hoarder Insignia

translations.description: A raven insignia used by members of the Treasure Hoarders to identify each other. The Treasure Hoarders ask for no resume. Anyone who has an insatiable desire for treasure and is backed up by an equal amount of courage can become a worthy member.
translations.name: Silver Raven Insignia

translations.description: A raven insignia that symbolizes the pride and the guiding principle of the Treasure Hoarders. Whether it's hidden amidst the vastness of the land or in the depths of the seas, as long as there are treasures to be hunted down, the spirit of Treasure Hoarders, who will stop at nothing to acquire them, will never die.
translations.name: Golden Raven Insignia

translations.description: A broken bone mask that once belonged to some hilichurl. Now more broken than complete, it can no longer perform its primary function.
translations.name: Damaged Mask

translations.description: A bone mask covered in unidentifiable stains and a mysterious odor. Yet such is the devotion of hilichurls to masks that they will wear it nonetheless.
translations.name: Stained Mask

translations.description: A glossy bone mask with oil markings painted on it, meant to intimidate enemies. No-one really knows why hilichurls are so fascinated with masks. Some say it's because they don't want to see their own reflections in the water.
translations.name: Ominous Mask

translations.description: An insignia to identify the recruits. Makes one wonder about what the ones joining the Fatui's war machine were thinking.
translations.name: Recruit Insignia

translations.description: An insignia to identify the recruits. Makes one wonder about what the ones joining the Fatui's war machine were thinking.
translations.name: Recruit Insignia

translations.description: An armband to identify officers. The Fatui possess a colossal army, so there must be something extraordinary about the ones who achieved this rank within the group.
translations.name: Lieutenant Insignia

translations.description: Nectar extracted from the stamen of a Whopperflower that contains trace amounts of elements. The taste of the nectar has a hint of Sweet Flower in it.
translations.name: Whopperflower Nectar

translations.description: Nectar that is full of pure elements. Scholars generally concur that Whopperflowers are advanced life forms among the elemental plants, but there has yet to be a satisfactory explanation regarding their predatory habits.
translations.name: Shimmering Nectar

translations.description: A thick and sticky honey that is full of energy. The Whopperflower hunts by tricking its prey, a process it uses to possibly evolve into a more powerful and pure form.
translations.name: Energy Nectar

translations.description: A thick coating found on slimes. Most commonly seen material in elemental workshops.
translations.name: Slime Condensate

translations.description: Mildly purified slime secretions. Harmful to the skin. Please avoid direct exposure.
translations.name: Slime Secretions

translations.description: Concentrated slime essence. When left on its own, it will begin to move on its own.
translations.name: Slime Concentrate
Lost Prayer To The Sacred Winds
Boreal Wolf's Milk Tooth
translations.description:
Andrius' wolf pack is its blessed honor guard, and even the milk teeth of a wolf's cub possess great potential.
In the past, the gods had the responsibility to love all people, which made Andrius quite the oddball for only adopting abandoned babies and accepting wanderers.

translations.name: Boreal Wolf's Cracked Tooth
translations.description:
The life of a wolf is not without violence; broken bones or cracked teeth are nothing special.
Andrius found humans to be a disappointment, but believed babies to be innocent. If both the wolf pack and the adopted children chose each other, then they become a Lupical, a fated family.

translations.name: Boreal Wolf's Broken Fang
translations.description:
The wolf pack also understands that humans are not solitary creatures. The honorary broken tooth is a parting gift said to bring protection and luck.
In the legends of a far-off world, a female wolf once adopted two great humans. Their home was known as the Cave of Wolves, or Lupercal - that word meaning the same thing as Lupical does in this world.

translations.name: Boreal Wolf's Nostalgia
translations.description: The Wolf King, believing itself to despise humans, thought itself unable to envision a happy life for humanity, making it unworthy of becoming the Lord of the Winds of the world. Therefore, it chose to disappear. Yet, in truth, it gazed on the ones the world abandoned ever so gently.

translations.name: Tile of Decarabian's Tower
translations.description: The place now known as Stormterror's Lair was once the capital city of Decarabian, the God of Storms. Since this dream of prosperity was created entirely by his divine might, the broken pieces left behind by the shattering of that dream still possess great power.

translations.name: Debris of Decarabian's City
translations.description: Decarabian, the God of Storms, was content with the capital city he had raised, and accepted the worship of the people from atop his tower. But he knew not that the people did not bow to him out of respect or adoration.

translations.name: Fragment of Decarabian's Epic
translations.description: Andrius once declared war upon Decarabian, but failed to even scratch the capital of the Lord of the Tower. If it were not for the song of freedom that shattered the city in an instant, Decarabian's dream would have gone on forever.

translations.name: Scattered Piece of Decarabian's Dream
translations.description:
The people did not bow to Decarabian out of respect or adoration, but because the harsh winds had laid them low. This was the shattered dream and ambition of the Anemo Archon before the rise of Barbatos.
He tried so hard to make his dream come true, and so the fragments of that dream are still mighty.

translations.name: Fetters of the Dandelion Gladiator
translations.description:
It's a human thing to exaggerate on a hero's story, even to the point of elevating the fetters that once bound the hero to the level of an enemy of true freedom.
As a result, these fetters were granted extraordinary powers.

translations.name: Chains of the Dandelion Gladiator
translations.description: The chains that once bound the great hero Vennessa. In truth, all gladiators would have worn chains in that era, and Vennessa was but one of them.

translations.name: Shackles of the Dandelion Gladiator
translations.description:
Vennessa was not truly bound by her chains. If she had so wished, no ordinary physical constraints forged in Mondstadt could have held her, for the land there yielded no ore of exceptional quality, nor did it possess the divine flame of her ancestral home.
She was only bound by her responsibility to take care of her tribespeople.

translations.name: Dream of the Dandelion Gladiator
translations.description:
Vennessa was freed from her slavery, but that which constrained her only grew greater - from her tribesmen to all of Mondstadt, and even to the concept of freedom itself, extending to the whole world.
What she really hoped for, in truth, was that the world might grow stronger.

translations.name: Luminous Sands from Guyun
translations.description: The stone pillars that tower amid the Guyun Stone Forest were once the stone lances Morax used to defeat his enemies. As time passed, the body of these gods penetrated into the pillars, granting them divinity. The pillars would sometimes shed crumbs of hatred and curses.

translations.name: Lustrous Stone from Guyun
translations.description: To the informed, Guyun Stone Forest is not some miraculous sight on the sea to behold, but the cemetery of the former gods of Liyue. Hatred and filth have periodically raised up from it, but all have been subdued by a demon-conquering young man.

translations.name: Relic from Guyun
translations.description: The stone lance has a glimmering core formed by the power of the defeated gods. Their hatred is not directed at Morax, for they have lost themselves a long time ago and are incapable of holding personal grudges.

translations.name: Divine Body from Guyun
translations.description: That which lurks within and animates this relic are the divine remains of lamenting gods. They are unrealized ideals, designs for a prosperous humanity that could never be. They may now lie deep within stone and sea, but they will not go quietly into the night.

translations.name: Mist Veiled Lead Elixir
translations.description: Jueyun Karst is the realm of the mighty and illuminated adepti. But other than the ability to control the elements of the world, Jueyun Karst is also home to three other untold secrets: Danding (Alchemy), Fulu (Sigils), and Waijing (Sub-Space Creation).

translations.name: Mist Veiled Mercury Elixir
translations.description: With Fulu (Sigils), the adepti can store their power in the form of symbols, and with Waijing (Sub-Space Creation) they can fashion a cosmic paradise with the power of their minds. The manufacture of elixirs, however, has always been shrouded in mystery, for certain death follows for any who swallow them.

translations.name: Mist Veiled Gold Elixir
translations.description:
Elixirs are in fact pills made from metal alloys. They were created by the adepti, and are able to grant weapons transcendent powers.
However, they are rarely seen in the world due to the hubris of the practitioners of martial arts, who prized the ways of combat over the paths of the adepti.

translations.name: Mist Veiled Primo Elixir
translations.description: An elixir of the highest quality. It embodies a state of intertwining order and chaos, and is said to mirror how the world was when it was first created. Of course, a certain someone knows that this was not the case.

translations.name: Grain of Aerosiderite
translations.description: A black meteor once fell beyond Liyue's Sea of Clouds, said to have fallen to vanquish a monster. However, it was stained by powerful tainted blood, so this item no longer possesses the pure power of Rex Lapis.

translations.name: Piece of Aerosiderite
translations.description:
Rumors of sea monsters are commonplace in Liyue, since the other-shore is an unknown region that lies outside of Teyvat.
Without the protection of The Seven, all that lies beyond is unknown chaos. Only power beyond the order of Teyvat is able to stain the power of Rex Lapis black.

translations.name: Bit of Aerosiderite
translations.description: The coastal nations of Teyvat refer to the region beyond the protection of The Seven as the Dark Sea. It is said many defeated gods refused to live under the new order of The Seven, so they fled to remote islands and became evil gods. However, their powers came from the same source as Rex Lapis, separate from this all-devouring darkness.

translations.name: Chunk of Aerosiderite
translations.description: When Khaenri'ah was destroyed, a great sinner created endless monsters with alien, dark blood flowing through their veins. They rampaged across the land, destroying all in their paths. Their lives were mutations, caused by powers beyond this world. The black serpentine dragon Durin that attacked Mondstadt was such a mutation.

translations.name: Heavy Horn
translations.description: A crude horn used by hilichurls to warn each other. Given the damage to the horn, it won't be warning anyone any time soon.

translations.name: Black Bronze Horn
translations.description: A metallic monster horn that can only be obtained from especially strong hilichurls, since blowing on the horn takes real strength.

translations.name: Black Crystal Horn
translations.description: A metallic horn with an ominous shine decorated with black crystals of an unknown source. It has hardly been used at all. It is likely a ceremonial item of the hilichurls'.

translations.name: Dead Ley Line Branch
translations.description: Fragile branches from deep within the earth. Even after years of age, from beneath it's mottled surface you can see that its power is not yet entirely lost.

translations.name: Dead Ley Line Leaves
translations.description: A twig from deep within the earth. Though it is far from where it once lay, its leaves still pulsate with energy.

translations.name: Ley Line Sprouts
translations.description: It is said that there was a great tree whose roots once spread out to every corner of the world, and this branch is said to be part of it. It is almost if it was never broken off and taken far away, for its vitality is such that it still sprouts new leaves even now.

translations.name: Fragile Bone Shard
translations.description: A bone shard once carried by a Geovishap Hatchling. Although they are quite fragile, they seem to still harbor some indescribable power.

translations.name: Sturdy Bone Shard
translations.description:
A fragment of an unknown creature's bones that appear to be prized by Geovishap Hatchlings for some reason.
The fragment appears to be quite aged. Despite being dragon-like beasts with no spoken language, they still seem to have some sort of special affection for these bone shards.

translations.name: Fossilized Bone Shard
translations.description:
A fossilized bone fragment sometimes found after defeating Geovishap Hatchlings.
Geovishap Hatchlings all dream of growing into great dragons one day. They see these fossils as dragon bones and greatly cherish them, perhaps because they too hope to attain the dragons' longevity and power.

translations.name: Mist Grass Pollen
translations.description: Strange spores created by Mist Grass in enclosed spaces. They are the Cicins' favorite food.

translations.name: Mist Grass
translations.description: Well-preserved Mist Grass. Some would take advantage of the Cicins' love for the Mist Grass to control them.

translations.name: Mist Grass Wick
translations.description: A rare bundle of Mist Grass that gives off a faint glow. Those who carry it invite both the Cicins and misfortune.

translations.name: Hunter's Sacrificial Knife
translations.description: A sharp alloy weapon. Though its owner has been lost, it still reflects a disturbingly cold light.

translations.name: Agent's Sacrificial Knife
translations.description: An oddly-shaped weapon made with superior Snezhnayan technology that once belonged to a senior agent. Proper training is required for using this strange weapon.

translations.name: Inspector's Sacrificial Knife
translations.description: In the hands of its lord, this fierce weapon has handled many "debts." No-one has eyes in the back of their heads, and this weapon and its related techniques are designed around that weakness.

translations.name: Chaos Device
translations.description: Comes from ancient defunct relic structures. A part that once held the structure together. Its aesthetically-pleasing engineering is quite exquisite.

translations.name: Chaos Circuit
translations.description: Comes from ancient defunct relic structures. Was once a logic circuit responsible for movement functions. Sadly, no-one is able to make sense of how it worked.

translations.name: Chaos Core
translations.description: Comes from ancient defunct relic structures. The core that once drove a mechanical beast. Should you come to understand its workings and reproduce it, you could perhaps change the world.
